cyclone.name: MARCO
cyclone.current_location: about 30 miles NNE of Cabo Gracias a Dios on the Nicaragua/Honduras border
cyclone.trajectory: tracking northwest across the northwest Caribbean, crossing the Yucatan Peninsula Saturday night, then moving north-northwest into the central Gulf of Mexico toward the north-west Gulf Coast early next week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: north-west Gulf Coast (likely southwest Louisiana or near the TX/LA border)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch from Punta Herrero to Cancun, Mexico; no U.S. coast yet
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning from Honduras/Nicaragua border to Punta Castilla Honduras, Bay Islands, Puerto Cabezas Nicaragua to border, Punta Herrero to Cancun
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Coasts of eastern Honduras, northeast Nicaragua, eastern Yucatan, and eventually the northern Gulf Coast from Texas to Mississippi
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (35–45 mph) with higher gusts possible late Monday into Tuesday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2–4 ft surge possible along the upper Texas coast including Sabine Pass/Port Arthur if the center makes landfall nearby.
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands associated with Marco could deliver 4–6 inches of rain with locally higher amounts and flash-flood potential.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes in outer rainbands and reduced visibility/seas >8 ft in the approaches to Sabine/Neches channels.
